DataElement.preferredName: Patient Disease Body Surface Area Range Text Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text entry to represent the range between the highest and lowest percentage of surface area of the body of the patient that is affected by the disease under investigation or study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The surface area of the body of the patient that is affected by the disease under investigation or study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional exent of the body surface.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Body Surface Area Range Text Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text entry to signify a range between the highest and lowest percent of the body surface area of a person.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Range; the difference between the lowest and highest numerical values.:Text; the words of something written.:The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: revised and updated for ISO compliance
